item.title: Coupled Climate Carbon Cycle Model Intercomparison Project

item.title: Detection and Attribution Model Intercomparison Project

item.title: Ice Sheet Model Intercomparison Project for CMIP6

item.label: land
item.title: Grid used for land surface modelling

item.description: Definitions of all the coordinate variables used in the CMIP6 data request
item.label: grids
item.title: Fixed coordinate variables

item.description: Variables with no time dependency
item.label: fx
item.title: Fixed variables

item.description: Annual mean variables on the ocean grid.
item.label: Oyr
item.title: Annual ocean variables

item.comment: For CMIP5 there was "Oclim" for ocean climatologies, and atmospheric climatologies were in Amon. Moving Atmospheric climatologies to Clim gives us a strict hierarchy with a single "frequency" in each table.
item.description: Monthly Mean Climatology
item.label: Clim
item.title: Monthly climatologies

item.description: Monthly Mean Ocean Fields, Including Biogechemical Field
item.label: Omon
item.title: Monthly ocean variables

item.description: Monthly Mean Atmospheric Fields and Some Surface Field
item.label: Amon
item.title: Montly atmospheric variables (excluding composition and radiation)

item.description: Monthly Mean Land Cryosphere Fields
item.label: LImon
item.title: Monthly land ice

item.comment: "land" as in "land grid" -- not including variables on atmospheric grid requested for analysis of land processes
item.description: Monthly Mean Land Fields, Including Physical, Vegetation, Soil, and Biogeochemical Variables
item.label: Lmon
item.title: Monthly land variables

item.description: Monthly Mean Ocean Cryosphere Fields
item.label: OImon
item.title: Sea-ice

item.comment: Used in CMIP5; not requested by CfMIP in CMIP6, but, provisionally, by HighResMIP
item.description: Monthly Offline Cloud Diagnostic Fields
item.label: cfOff
item.title: Offline diagnostics for cloud forcing analysis

item.comment: Contains radiative fields from cfMon; some duplication with Amon
item.label: Rmon
item.title: Monthly atmospheric radiation data

item.description: Monthly atmospheric composition, including aerosols and properties of aerosols (but see Rmon for radiation quantities)
item.label: Cmon
item.title: Monthly Atmospheric Composition Data

item.description: Daily Mean Atmosphere, Ocean and Surface Fields
item.label: Oday
item.title: Daily ocean data

item.label: Aday
item.title: Daily atmospheric data, excluding composition and cloud forcing

item.label: cfDay
item.title: Daily data associated with cloud forcing

item.description: Fields (Sampled Every 6 Hours) for Driving Regional Models
item.label: 6hrLev
item.title: 6-hourly atmospheric data on model levels

item.comment: Only 3 levels in CMIP5, more levels requested in CMIP6 by HighResMIP (low priority)
item.description: Fields (Sampled Every 6 Hours) for Storm-Track Analysis and other Advanced Diagnostic Applications
item.label: 6hrPlev
item.title: 6-hourly atmospheric data on pressure levels

item.comment: CMIP5 had two MIP tables at 3hr frequency, "3hr" and "cf3hr". In some cases variables were requested as instantaneous in one and accumulated in the other. Making two tables with clear definitions should make it easier to see what is going on.
item.label: 3hrPoint
item.title: 3-hourly data, instantaenous fields

item.description: Atmospheric and Surface Fields Sampled Every 3 Hours
item.label: 3hrAcc
item.title: 3-hourly data, accumulated fields

item.comment: Includes cfsites and data for highresmip
item.label: subhr

timeSlice.title: Time slices used in data request

item.description: Modelling centres must commit to supplying all priority 1 variables associated with at least one science question for Tier 1 experiments of any MIP which they participate in;
item.title: High

item.description: Expected to be used in multi-model diagnostics; models not supplying these variables may be omitted from some parts of the inter-comparison;
item.title: Medium

item.description: Experimental -- used for exploring new capabilities and/or unlikely to be used in multi-model diagnostic.
item.title: Low

item.description: World Climate Research Programme (WCRP) Working Group on Coupled Modeling
item.label: wgcm
item.title: WGCM

item.description: Full specifications of vocabularies used for formatting, archiving and dsitribution of CMIP data
item.label: drvocabs
item.title: DRVoc

item.description: This table defines the quantities used to specify CMOR dimensions. Further information is in the CMOR documentation.
item.label: cmorDimAttr
item.title: Attributes of CMOR dimensions

item.description: A list of CMOR tables in which this dimension is used.
item.label: tables
item.title: Tables using this dimension

item.description: Name used by CMOR -- unique within one set of tables
item.label: CmorName
item.title: CMOR name

item.description: Name used for variable and dimension in netcdf files
item.label: name
item.title: Name in file

item.description: Value copied into NetCDF attribute 'long_name' of dimension variable
item.label: longname
item.title: Long name

item.description: For spatial or temporal dimensions -- should take the value X, Y, Z or T. Otherwise blank. Value copied into NetCDF attribute of dimension variable
item.label: axis
item.title: NetCDF axis attribute

item.description: Value copied into NetCDF attribute of dimension variable
item.label: units
item.title: Units

item.description: Set "ok" if the axis is an index (no netcdf variable will be created).
item.label: index
item.title: Is this an index dimension?

item.description: Used as variable name for coordinate values when these cannot be held in the axis variable (e.g. when the coordinate values are words).
item.label: coords
item.title: NetCDF coords attribute

item.description: 'Yes' or 'No', to indicate whether a bounds variable is needed.
item.label: bounds
item.title: Are bounds required?

item.description: Set to 'increasing' or 'decreasing'.
item.label: direction
item.title: Order of values in axis variable

item.description: Type (e.g. 'double', 'character', 'integer')
item.label: type
item.title: Type of axis values

item.description: This attribute is used for vertical coordinates, indicates whether the dimension increases upwards or downwards (valid values are 'up', 'down', or blank)
item.label: positive
item.title: NetCDF positive attribute

item.description: For array dimensions see 'requested'
item.label: value
item.title: Value of singleton dimension

item.description: For array dimensions see 'boundsreq'
item.label: bounds_values
item.title: Bounds of a singleton dimension

item.description: For singleton dimensions see 'value'
item.label: requested
item.title: Values of array dimensions

item.description: For singleton dimensions see 'bounds_value'
item.label: boundsreq
item.title: Bounds Requested

item.description: Variance from requested values that is tolerated
item.label: tolerance
item.title: Tolerance on requested values

item.description: Value copied into NetCDF attribute of dimension variable
item.label: formula
item.title: NetCDF formula_terms attribute

item.description: Value copied into NetCDF attribute of dimension variable
item.label: z_factors
item.title: NetCDF z_factors attribute

item.description: Value copied into NetCDF attribute of dimension variable
item.label: z_bounds_factors
item.title: NetCDF z_bounds_factors

item.description: The weighted time mean is important when a time varying mask is used (e.g. sea ice)
item.label: WM
item.title: weighted time mean

item.description: specialised definition of variable which is more tightly constrained than the CF standard name; variables marked with this will need special attention.
item.label: SD
item.title: specialised definition
